text: The Ukrainian Catholic Eparchy of Chełm–Bełz (or Chełm–Bełz of the Ukrainians ) was an Eparchy (Eastern Catholic diocese) of the particular Ukrainian Greek Catholic Church sui iuris (Byzantine Rite) in part of Poland from 1596 till 1875. == History == * Established in 1596 as Diocese of Chełm–Bełz / Chelmen(sis) et Belthien(sis) Rutenorum (Latin), on Polish (or imperial Russian) territory not previously served by the particular church. * Suppressed on 18 March 1875 without successor. ==Episcopal ordinaries== (all Ukrainian Rite) ;Suffragan Eparchs (Bishops) of Chełm–Bełz * Dionysius (Zbyruyskyy) (1596 – 1603) * Arseniusz Joann (1604 – 1619) * Atanazy Pakosta (1619 – death 1625?) * Teodor Mieleszko (1625 – 1626) * Metody Terlecki, Basilian Order of Saint Josaphat (O.S.B.M.) (1630 – death 1649.06.07) * Atanazy Zachariasz Furs (1649 – death 1649) * Jakub Jan Susza, O.S.B.M. (1652 – death 1687.09.04) * Augustyn Aleksander Łodziata (1687 – death 1691?) * Jan Małachowski (1691 – death 1693), previously Bishop of Przemyśl of the Ukrainians (Poland) (1670 – 1691) * Gedeon Woyna-Orański (1693 – 1709) * Josyf Levyckyj (1711 – death 1730.06.15) * Felicjan Filip Wołodkowicz (Feliks Filipp Volodkovič), O.S.B.M. (1731 – 1756.01.12), next Coadjutor Archbishop of Kyiv–Halyč of the Ukrainians (Ukraine) (1756.01.12 – 1762.07.18), Eparch (Bishop) of Volodymyr–Brėst of the Ukrainians (Ukraine) (1758.11.22 – 1778.02.01), Metropolitan Archeparch (Archbishop) of Kyiv–Halyč of the Ukrainians (1762.07.18 – death 1778.02.01) * Maksymilian Rylo, O.S.B.M. (1758 – 1784) * Tadeusz Teodozy Rostocki, O.S.B.M. (1784.07.02 – 1790.04.04), next Coadjutor Archbishop of Kyiv–Halyč of the Ukrainians (Ukraine) (1785.04.11 – 1788.11.01), succeeding as Metropolitan Archeparch (Archbishop) of Kyiv–Halyč of the Ukrainians (Ukraine) (1788.11.01 – death 1805.01.25) * Porfiriusz Skarbek-Ważyński (1790 – death 1804.03.09) * Ferdynand Dąbrowa-Ciechanowski, O.S.B.M. (1810.07.18 – death 1828.04.07) * Filip Felicjan Szumborski, O.S.B.M. (1830.01.29 – death 1851.01.19) * Jan Teraszkiewicz (1851.01 – death 1863.03.01), succeeding as former Auxiliary Bishop of Chełm–Bełz of the Ukrainians (1842.08.30 – 1851.01) * Jan Mikołaj Kaliński (1863.03.16 – death 1866.10.19) * Michał Kuzemśki (1868.06.22 – retired 1871), died 1879. == See also == * the former Roman Catholic Diocese of Chełm(-Lublin) * List of Catholic dioceses in Poland == References == == Sources and external links == * GCatholic - data for all sections Category:Chełm Chełm–Belz Chełm–Belz Category:Eastern Catholicism in the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth Category:Former dioceses in Europe Category:1596 establishments Category:Religious organizations established in the 1590s Category:16th- century establishments in Poland Category:Religious organizations disestablished in 1875 Category:19th-century disestablishments in Poland Category:1870s disestablishments in the Russian Empire
title: Ukrainian Catholic Eparchy of Chełm–Belz
